meanings.definition: To make something free from bacteria or other microorganisms.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will sterilize the equipment before the surgery.
meanings.sent2: It is important to sterilize baby bottles to keep them clean.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sterilized my favorite shirt in the hot wash!
meanings.sent4: Her smile could sterilize any doubts in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to sterilize the room, making it feel fresh and pure.

meanings.definition: To make someone unable to produce offspring.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian recommended sterilizing the stray cat to control the population.
meanings.sent2: Some people choose to sterilize their pets to prevent unwanted litters.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to sterilize the rabbit, leaving it unable to multiply!
meanings.sent4: His words had the power to sterilize any hope of reconciliation.
meanings.sent5: The potion had a mysterious ability to sterilize any living creature it touched.

meanings.definition: To make something free from living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The cleaning crew will sterilize the entire laboratory to maintain a sterile environment.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to sterilize water before drinking it in the wilderness.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's laser vision could sterilize any threat in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her determination seemed to sterilize any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The powerful disinfectant could sterilize any surface with just one spray.
